section.name: Overview
section.p: Most of Vulcan configuration can be accomplished using the Setup section of the application. However, there are a few settings which require you to make changes manually. Most users will not need to modify these settings.

The advanced settings are stored in an XML file under the location where you unpacked Vulcan, in a sub-directory named WEB-INF, called beans.xml. Many of the configuratin values in this file should not be modified (or Vulcan may stop working). However, the following sections indicate some of the settings which you may want to customize.

section.name: Vulcan Home
section.p: Vulcan uses a directory to store configuration data about your projects, including build outcomes and plugin data. By default Vulcan will use:

tr.td: If you run Vulcan as a normal user, configuration data will go in the C:\Documents and Settings\username\Application Data\vulacn. If you run Vulcan as a Windows Service, by default it will run as LocalSystem. Since that account does not have a home directory, Vulcan configuration will end up in C:\Application Data\vulcan. This is probably not what you want, so you can either configure the Apache Tomcat service to run as some other user, or change Vulcan's configRoot.
Configuration data will go in a subdirectory named vulcan under the home directory of the user running Apache Tomcat, e.g. /home/joe/vulcan.

section.p: If you want Vulcan to use a different location, find the configRoot property in beans.xml and change the value to your desired location.
